title: Cabinet approves new circulars on student admissions for Grades 2–11
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal by Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya to cancel the existing circulars on student admissions from Grades 2 to 11, excluding Grades 5 and 6, and to issue new guidelines.

title: Photos released of victims before Ella bus crash
byline: Several photographs of the Tangalle Municipal Council employees, taken in Ella shortly before last night’s tragic bus accident, were released to the media.

title: Trump to rebrand Pentagon as Department of War
byline: US President Donald Trump is directing that the Department of Defense be known as the Department of War.

title: Ella bus crash claims 15 lives, many injured
byline: A tragic bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya main road last night (4) claimed the lives of at least 15 people, including the driver and nine women, police confirmed.

title: Pacific Angel 2025 begins next week
byline: Sri Lanka will host Exercise Pacific Angel 2025 from September 8 to 12, bringing together regional defence partners for joint humanitarian assistance and disaster relief (HADR) training.

title: CID flooded with 60,000 complaints
byline: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) has been flooded with 60,000 complaints and the government is considering reducing the number of complaints received to the CID as it is difficult for the department to handle such a large number of complaints, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said yesterday.

title: SUV driver taken into custody over Ella bus accident
byline: The driver of the SUV involved in a collision with the bus before it plunged into a precipice in Ella has been taken into police custody. Authorities said the driver faces charges of negligence and failing to prevent the accident.

title: Ella accident: Tangalle council staff among 15, one missing
byline: Fifteen people, including the Tangalle Urban Council Secretary, 12 council employees, two children, and the bus driver, were killed in a bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya main road last night, Deputy Minister of Local Government Ruwan Senarath said. A female passenger remains missing.

title: Rubio says US will ’blow up’ foreign crime groups if needed
byline: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has said the US will ’’blow up’’ foreign crime groups if needed, possibly in collaboration with other countries.

title: Two Army officers injured during Ella bus rescue operation
byline: Two Army officers sustained injuries while attempting to descend a precipice with ropes to rescue passengers of the excursion bus that plunged into a ravine at 15th Kanuwa on the Ella–Wellawaya main road last night, Ella Police said.

title: SLAF deploys helicopters for Ella bus accident rescue
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has deployed a MI-17 helicopter at the SLAF Combat Training School in Diyatalawa and a Bell 412 helicopter at SLAF Station Weerawila to support rescue operations following last night’s bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya road.

title: ’I and other MPs committed to make policy to prevent road accidents’: Sajith
byline: While expressing his deep sadness on the Ella bus accident, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today that he and other MPs are committed to taking possible decisions necessary to minimise the occurrence of such incidents in the future.

title: Two powerful aftershocks hit Afghanistan after earthquakes killed 2,200
byline: Two powerful aftershocks shook eastern Afghanistan in a span of 12 hours, the German Research Center for Geosciences (GFZ) said, triggering fears of more deaths and destruction on Friday in a region where about 2,200 people died in quakes in four days.

title: ’’Conductor shouted all to go down and hold tight as brakes fail’’ Ella accident survivor
byline: Explaining her tragic experience, a survivor of the Ella bus accident said that the conductor of the bus had shouted and said all to go down and hold tight as the brake system of the bus had failed.

title: Trump signs order to bring lower Japanese auto tariffs into effect
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump signed an order on Thursday to implement lower tariffs on Japanese automobile imports and other products that were announced in July, providing some relief to Japan’s export-heavy economy.

title: Colombo to face 9-hour water supply interruption tomorrow
byline: Residents in selected areas of Colombo will experience a 9-hour water supply disruption tomorrow (6), the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Trump to rebrand Pentagon as Department of War
byline: US President Donald Trump is directing that the Department of Defense be known as the Department of War.

title: Another rapper arrested over explosives case
byline: Kahathuduwa Police arrested another popular rapper in connection with the supply of explosives to Madhava Prasad, also known as ’Maduwa’, who was taken into custody earlier this week.

title: Thai parliament elects Anutin Charnvirakul as prime minister
byline: Thailand’s parliament has elected Anutin Charnvirakul, leader of the conservative opposition Bhumjaithai party, as the country’s prime minister.

title: Mahinda saddened by Ella bus accident
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said he is profoundly saddened by the tragic bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya route.

title: Indian national arrested with Kush worth Rs. 100 mn
byline: An Indian national was arrested while attempting to smuggle in 10.750 kilos of Kush worth over Rs. 100 million through the Green Chanel of the Bandaranaike International Airport early this morning.

title: Ella bus accident: Seven patients in serious condition, one in ICU: Hospital Director
byline: Seven patients out of those injured in the Ella bus accident are in critical condition, Director of the Badulla Hospital Dr. Palitha Rajapaksa said.

title: Roshan Mahanama resigns from National Sports Council
byline: Former Sri Lanka cricketer and international match referee Roshan Mahanama has resigned from his position as a member of the National Sports Council (NSC) with immediate effect, due to personal reasons.

title: Scheduled 9-hour water cut in Colombo cancelled – NWSDB
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has said that the previously scheduled 9-hour water cut in several areas of Colombo, set for tomorrow, has been cancelled.

title: 'I and other MPs committed to make policy to prevent road accidents’: Sajith
byline: While expressing his deep sadness on the Ella bus accident, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today that he and other MPs are committed to taking possible decisions necessary to minimise the occurrence of such incidents in the future.

title: Upcountry line disrupted as track car engine derails twice
byline: Railway traffic along the Upcountry Line was disrupted for nearly four hours today after the engine of a track car carrying a crane for railway repairs derailed on two separate occasions.

title: Chemicals linked to ICE production seized in Middeniya
byline: A stock of chemical substances believed to be used in the production of crystal methamphetamine (ICE) has been seized in the Middeniya area, allegedly linked to underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme.

title: Catholic Church against converting Kachchatheevu island as tourist destination
byline: Bishop of Jaffna Rt. Rev. Dr. Justin Bernard Gnanapragasam voiced his opposition on behalf of the diocese against the government’s move to covert Kachchatheevu Island into a touriist destination.

title: UK Deputy PM resigns amid stamp duty controversy
byline: Angela Rayner has resigned as housing secretary and deputy prime minister two days after admitting she underpaid the stamp duty due on her £800,000 flat in Hove.

title: Ella–Wellawaya bus tragedy echoes past accident in 2002
byline: The fatal bus accident that occurred last night (September 04) on the Ella–Wellawaya main road has drawn eerie parallels to a similar tragedy reported at the very same location 23 years ago.

title: Foreign healthcare worker assists local team after Ella–Wellawaya bus tragedy
byline: A female foreign healthcare worker was seen assisting Sri Lankan medical teams in the aftermath of the tragic bus accident that occurred last night (04) on the Ella–Wellawaya main road.

title: Oldest member of Royal Family Duchess of Kent dies
byline: The Duchess of Kent has died at the age of 92, Buckingham Palace has announced.

title: Three injured as three-wheeler plunges down precipice in Watawala
byline: Three people, including two children, were injured when a three-wheeler veered off the road and plunged down a 50-foot precipice in the Watawala today.

title: Ella–Wellawaya tragedy: Families of victims to receive Rs. 1Mn compensation
byline: The Government has decided to grant compensation of Rs. 1 million each to the families of those who lost their lives in the fatal bus accident that occurred last night (04) on the Ella–Wellawaya main road.

title: Nepal bans Facebook, X, YouTube, 23 other social media platforms
byline: Nepal said that it would ask its telecommunications agency to block access to several social media platforms including Facebook, Youtube, X and LinkedIn, after a deadline for them to register with authorities had passed the previous day.

title: Tourists join rescue efforts after Ella–Wellawaya bus tragedy
byline: A large number of foreign tourists rushed to assist the injured in the aftermath of the fatal bus accident that took place last night (04) on the Ella–Wellawaya main road.

title: Sri Lanka’s non-participation in SCO summit a mistake: Opposition MP
byline: Sri Lanka’s non-participation in the recently concluded Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit held in China could be a mistake as it will damage its image as a nation with a non-aligned foreign policy in addition to denial of economic benefits, an opposition MP said today.

title: Trump says India and Russia appear ’’lost’’ to ’’deepest, darkest China’’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said India and Russia seem to have been ’’lost’’ to China after their leaders met with Chinese President Xi Jinping this week, expressing annoyance at New Delhi and Moscow as Beijing pushes a new world order.

title: Sri Lanka urges space for domestic reforms, rejects international interventions
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka (GoSL) has reiterated its commitment to advancing transformative reforms through domestic processes while rejecting calls for international interventions outlined in the latest report by the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR).
